channel.title: Dragon Throwing Knife V3 [ Meta ] [ DUAL WIELD ] [ P++ ]
channel.description:
YAY!! Took me for ever to release bcoz I really was'nt bothered to upload it, this is made in Meta and It is made 100% by me well comment after reading this post plz
Top view: [IMG]http://i56.tinypic.com/2q3vux2.png[/img]
Side View(not really necassary): [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/2j0z8r5.png[/img]
ohk this might be my last dragon throwing knife realese so comment on what I should make next (thinking with something to do with bandos)
[shadow=Purple,left]Leave a (like) in your comment if you liked it[/shadow]

item.title: Dragon Throwing Knife V3 [ Meta ] [ DUAL WIELD ] [ P++ ]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:49, topic:379428”]^Legit.
Wanderer, your models are very nice. And where did you get the image?[/quote]
I was looking through the old topics in the models section and someone requested these. So I saved the picture. Just now tried making one of them. I’d have the say the topology on this sword is great. I’m almost done with the hilt. May try and sell it on rune serba for like 10$ haha.

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon Throwing Knife V3 [ Meta ] [ DUAL WIELD ] [ P++ ]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

ranger squad:

Infact, I find tracing to be a lot more accurate.

You can use primitives and be accurate. Just scale them around the image. Here’s something I’m working on right now and I can say it is quite accurate.

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon Throwing Knife V3 [ Meta ] [ DUAL WIELD ] [ P++ ]
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

[quote=“the wanderer, post:45, topic:379428”][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=475272.msg3477364#msg3477364 date=1295812863]

Mask - Traced
Key - Traced
Sword - Prim

but the sword looks soo messy :O… not that messy but you know what i mean
[/quote]
It’s triangulated that’s why it looks messy. I hope I proved my point that tracing isn’t bad. As long as you know how to use it. And it is quite slower. I could never of created such a clean wireframe on that mask if I hadn’t looked at models with good polygonal flow and used primitives.[/quote]

true

Read full topic
item.source: Dragon Throwing Knife V3 [ Meta ] [ DUAL WIELD ] [ P++ ]

item.title: Dragon Throwing Knife V3 [ Meta ] [ DUAL WIELD ] [ P++ ]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:44, topic:379428”][quote author=the wanderer link=topic=475272.msg3477353#msg3477353 date=1295812440]
Mask - Traced
Key - Traced
Sword - Prim
[/quote]

but the sword looks soo messy :O… not that messy but you know what i mean :P[/quote]
It’s triangulated that’s why it looks messy. I hope I proved my point that tracing isn’t bad. As long as you know how to use it. And it is quite slower. I could never of created such a clean wireframe on that mask if I hadn’t looked at models with good polygonal flow and used primitives.

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon Throwing Knife V3 [ Meta ] [ DUAL WIELD ] [ P++ ]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Tracing is bad because you don’t learn how to create a good polygonal flow. Here’s three models I have made. You tell me which ones are traced and which aren’t. Two of them are traced. The other one is primitives. Also primitives speed up your modeling process.

Read full topic
